metadata.jobDescription: Sr. Product Manager for Walrus, owning the core data platform and key product surfaces including Walrus Sites. Role sits at intersection of storage, data delivery, and developer experience. Responsible for developer-facing abstractions (APIs, SDKs, tooling, documentation), working with engineering on performance/scalability/reliability, and supporting internal teams + external partners adopting Walrus in production.

hero.status: Open to Platform PM roles — Distributed Storage, Developer Infrastructure, Web3
hero.subheadline: Senior PM with 8+ years building infrastructure products developers love. From RPC APIs serving 1M+ daily requests to SDK ecosystems for gaming studios—I turn complex distributed systems into reliable, scalable platforms. Passionate about the intersection of storage, data delivery, and developer experience.

about.tagline: Eight years shipping infrastructure products that developers build on—from enterprise blockchain at Microsoft to institutional staking platforms. I find PMF in technical markets and turn engineering excellence into developer adoption.
bio: Currently at Anchorage Digital, I own staking infrastructure serving billions in AUM with zero slashing events. I've shipped 7+ L2 integrations (Optimism, Base, Arbitrum) using a RICE evaluation framework I built, reducing integration time by 40%. Before that, at Ankr I drove 15× revenue growth ($130K to $2M ARR) by repositioning RPC infrastructure from developers to protocols—building Advanced APIs and an SDK that scaled to 1M+ daily requests. At Forte, I designed Wallet-as-a-Service SDKs with MPC custody for AAA gaming studios.

At Dapper Labs, I led Flow CLI and Cadence Playground to reduce developer onboarding time by 60%. I started at Microsoft shipping Xbox royalties on Ethereum—one of the first production smart contracts in enterprise. Walrus's mission resonates deeply: I've spent my career making complex infrastructure accessible to developers, building the platforms that ecosystems depend on. I understand what it takes to evolve a protocol product from early adoption to production maturity while balancing performance, reliability, and developer experience.

highlights: Built ETF-grade staking infrastructure with zero slashing events—reliability at scale
Shipped 7+ L2 protocol integrations with 40% faster cycle time using RICE framework
Designed validator APIs serving billions in AUM for institutional clients
Drove 15× revenue growth by repositioning RPC infrastructure for protocol partnerships
Built Advanced APIs and Ankr.JS SDK scaling to 1M+ daily requests
Found PMF in commoditized market through developer experience differentiation
Designed Wallet-as-a-Service SDK with MPC custody for gaming studios
Built infrastructure enabling AAA partners to integrate Web3 seamlessly
Shipped SDK abstracting complex cryptography into simple developer APIs
Led Flow CLI and Cadence Playground reducing onboarding time by 60%
Shipped developer tools for blockchain developers at scale
Built documentation and tooling ecosystem for Flow protocol
Shipped Xbox royalties on Ethereum—first production smart contract at Microsoft
Built Docker/K8s orchestration for blockchain node infrastructure

caseStudies.reasoning: API infrastructure at scale, SDK development, developer tools, 15x revenue growth—directly parallel to Walrus platform PM responsibilities
Flow CLI and developer tools—exact match for Walrus developer-facing abstractions and tooling work
Infrastructure platform with reliability/performance requirements—demonstrates platform thinking and technical depth
Multi-quarter initiatives with cross-functional teams, framework building—relevant for Walrus ecosystem expansion
Pioneering blockchain infrastructure, enterprise production systems—shows ability to bring new technology to production

projects.reasoning: Developer tools for blockchain—directly relevant to Walrus Sites and developer experience
Framework development demonstrates builder mentality and system design skills
